title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, February 26, 1869
summary: Scott reports complications with attaining the necessary votes from the Methodist church "Trustees" to begin construction on a new schoolhouse and once again complains about pastor "Lewis's" fervent attempts to hamper the AMA's mission in Staunton.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Church/Religious Activity, Economy, Race Relations, American Civil War
